title: Fabaceae
summary: The Fabaceae /fəˈbeɪʃiː/ or Leguminosae,[6] commonly known as the legume, pea, or bean family, are a large and economically important family of flowering plants.  It includes trees, shrubs, and perennial or annual herbaceous plants, which are easily recognized by their fruit (legume) and their compound, stipulate leaves. Many legumes have characteristic flowers and fruits. The family is widely distributed, and is the third-largest land plant family in number of species, behind only the Orchidaceae and Asteraceae, with about 765 genera and nearly 20,000 known species[7].[8][9][1]
